articleContent.title: Arpeggio: 6th in A# (Shape: D)
articleContent.content:
# Arpeggio: 6th in A# (Shape: D)

An arpeggio is a musical technique where chords are played one note at a time in a sequence. The 6th in A# is a specific arpeggio played starting on the 6th note within an A# major scale. In this case, the arpeggio is based on the 6th note (which is F) and uses the shape of a D major chord.

## Breakdown of Notes and Intervals:

- F (Root)
- A# (Major 3rd)
- D (Perfect 5th)

## Genre and Musical Flavor:

This arpeggio, based on the 6th note in A#, has a smooth and soulful quality to it. It can be commonly heard in genres like soul, R&B, jazz, and even some pop music. When played in the context of these genres, it adds a rich and emotive flavor to the music.

## Songs Featuring the Arpeggio:

1. **"Isn't She Lovely" by Stevie Wonder**: This classic soul and R&B song features arpeggios based on the 6th note in A#, adding a melodic and soulful touch to the composition.

2. **"Don't Know Why" by Norah Jones**: In this jazz-influenced pop song, you can hear arpeggios based on the 6th note in A#, enhancing the smooth and jazzy vibe of the track.

3. **"Feel Like Makin' Love" by Roberta Flack**: This soulful ballad incorporates arpeggios based on the 6th note in A#, contributing to the romantic and emotive atmosphere of the song.
